output.conclusion: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of engineering mechanics principles, equipping experts with the tools to analyze and design complex mechanical systems.
output.introduction: Welcome to Engineering Mechanics for Experts. This course delves into advanced concepts and applications of statics, dynamics, and mechanics of materials, tailored for professionals seeking to enhance their expertise.

chapters.chapterTitle: Advanced Statics: Equilibrium of Rigid Bodies
chapters.description: Review of equilibrium conditions, free-body diagrams, and analysis of complex truss and frame structures.
Application of virtual work principle to determine equilibrium configurations and stability analysis.
Buckling analysis of columns and frames, critical load determination, and design considerations.
Angular velocity and acceleration, general plane motion, and analysis of mechanisms.

chapters.chapterTitle: Kinetics of Rigid Body Motion: Equations of Motion
chapters.description: Application of Newton's laws and Euler's equations to analyze the motion of rigid bodies.
Energy and momentum principles for rigid body dynamics, impact and collision analysis.
Principal stresses and strains, Mohr's circle, and stress concentration analysis.
Yield criteria, fracture mechanics, and fatigue analysis for structural design.
Shear center, unsymmetrical bending, and curved beam analysis.
Introduction to FEA, element types, meshing techniques, and boundary conditions.
Using FEA software to solve complex stress analysis, buckling, and vibration problems.
Nonlinear analysis, dynamic analysis, and optimization techniques using FEA.
